Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • Tile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Tile>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Lava, Monster, OneWayArrow, Water

    public class Tile
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Tile>
    This is the Top Level Class where most of the Game object are derived from.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int depth
      depth is needed to draw object in order as 2 tile can occupy same space.
      Game.Direction dir
      The Tile direction if there are any
      java.awt.Image img
      The representation of the Tile
      boolean isMovingAcrossScreen
      Monster shot twice within few second flies across the screen.
      boolean isSolid
      determine whether tile is solid/can be passed through
      Tile.ID oldtype
      to keep track of what kind of Tile they are/were before changing to another type and revert back
      int oldX
      Previous X-axis position before some action happened
      int oldY
      Previous Y-axis position before some action happened
      java.awt.Polygon shape
      The Shape of the Tile in order to determine collision
      Tile.ID type
      Current type of the Tile
      Game.Direction WaterDir
      Used for Water Tile that have a wind direction.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkCollision(java.awt.Rectangle mask1, java.awt.Rectangle mask2)
      Collision method for a Tile.Tile should not traverse any solid tile.
      int compareTo(Tile anotherTile) 
      void moveAcross_Screen(Game.Direction direction)
      Monster that are shot twice must flies across the screen and not collide with anything
      void moveTile(int movement)
      This Method decides how things work when moving object such as Green Block or Monster that have been shot once.A Green Block should only be allowed to be moved if the Character is Fully Colliding on either of the Four Side of the Block i.e partially colliding character with the block will not be allowed to push it.
      boolean Object_inBetween(java.lang.String direction)
      Search if there is an object between the direction of the tile and the Main Character and whether that object should act as a block or not in the path from the tile to the Character.The step of each Search should be the smallest step the main Character can move.
      void render(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Method that render the Tile on the screen.
      void update() 
      void updateLocation()
      this Method update the new location of the Monster when its flying across the screen at the update location speed.
      void updateMask()
      In order to determine collision we use a Square Mask at a size equal to the tile size and we must update its coordinates should the tile moves.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Method that render the Tile on the screen.

      • checkCollision

        public boolean checkCollision(java.awt.Rectangle mask1,
                     java.awt.Rectangle mask2)
        Collision method for a Tile.Tile should not traverse any solid tile. Returns whether there exist a collision.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Tile anotherTile)
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Tile>

      • moveAcross_Screen

        public void moveAcross_Screen(Game.Direction direction)
        Monster that are shot twice must flies across the screen and not collide with anything

      • Object_inBetween

        public boolean Object_inBetween(java.lang.String direction)
        Search if there is an object between the direction of the tile and the Main Character and whether that object should act as a block or not in the path from the tile to the Character.The step of each Search should be the smallest step the main Character can move.

      • moveTile

        public void moveTile(int movement)
        This Method decides how things work when moving object such as Green Block or Monster that have been shot once.A Green Block should only be allowed to be moved if the Character is Fully Colliding on either of the Four Side of the Block i.e partially colliding character with the block will not be allowed to push it. A Block or Monster can be moved into the Water only if they will be fully colliding with a Water tile once pushed and only if they are not currently colliding with Water. A Block or Monster may not be moved in the same direction as a One-Way Arrow object is pointing.

      • update

        public void update()

      • updateLocation

        public void updateLocation()
        this Method update the new location of the Monster when its flying across the screen at the update location speed.

      • updateMask

        public void updateMask()
        In order to determine collision we use a Square Mask at a size equal to the tile size and we must update its coordinates should the tile moves.
